description: Warabimochi is enjoying its limelight as Japanese brands heat up the competition. Read more at straitstimes.com.
title: Mochi mania: Renewed craze for trendy drinks, desserts with the chewy Japanese rice cake
title_page: Mochi mania: Renewed craze for trendy drinks, desserts with the chewy Japanese rice cake | The Straits Times
maintext:
SINGAPORE – Over the past six months, there has been much ado about everything mochi – that sticky Japanese rice cake made of sweet glutinous rice.
Usually filled with fruit or stuffed with red bean paste (also known as daifuku), it is a popular addition to desserts and bakes for its soft yet chewy texture.
